result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamar McNeal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Restitution set at zero.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to case 09CF1447.
Court orders the Wisconsin State prison system to keep the defendant and codefendant separate.  Court recommends defendant serve sentence at Racine Youthful offender correctional

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant is prohibited from using or selling illegal drugs.  No association with locations where drugs are consumed, sold, packaged
No contact with codefendant.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted and pay surcharge.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the folowing restrictions: firearm possession, voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar McNeal

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.  Copy mailed to defendant.
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant was not produced for today's hearing. Court ordered this matter adjourned. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Diane Rose Caspari in court, defendant Lamar McNeal not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Branch 25 in a lengthy homicide sentencing and is unable to hear this matter today. Parties do not object to an adjournment. ADA Sara Lewis will be taking over this matter for the State. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
09/26/2014 SENTENCING HEARING

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. State is requesting an adjournment in this matter until after the co-defendant has been sentenced in 14CF333. Defense does not object to an adjournment. Court grants State's request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.
RECALLED (court date 7/8/14 9:00am)

Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA commencing 06/26/2014 received and filed. (26 Pages.)  hgj

xxx  asst. da

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with attorney Diane R Caspari.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered the Repeater and Second and Subsequent Offense enhancers as to COUNT 7 be dismissed. 

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 7 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Court vacated jury trial date of 7/07/14. Parties requested this defendant be sentenced after the projected plea of the co-defendant in case 14CF333. Case adjourned to Branch 25. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Criminal Convictions Disclosure received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion to Introduce Purported "Other Acts" Evidence received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defense counsel in co-defendant's case (14CF333) filed a motion to adjourn final pretrial date. Parties notified. Court will grant the adjournment. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 070/07/2014. Case adjourned to June 26, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. for final pretrial in Branch 25.

ADA Sheldon contacted the court on a joint request to adjourn the final pretrial date scheduled for 05/15/2014. Parties are still waiting on the DNA results from the lab and the reports will not be finished until mid-May. Court grants joint request for adjournment and vacated final pretrial date of 05/15/2014. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 07/07/2014. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Final Pretrial scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. Jury Trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 9:00 a.m. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Diane R Caspari in court, defendant Lamar McNeal not in court, in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has received discovery.  Request for trial and final pretrial/motion date, granted.  Defense motions are due on or before 3-14-14; State's response is due on or before 4-4-14  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with attorney Diane R Caspari.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Nicole J Sheldon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Richard Schier-MPD Officer.  Exhibit #1 is received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMMANUEL A., SHAVAWN H., OPAL M., SERJIMMIE S., ARIELLE M., THEIR FAMILIES, RESIDENCES OR WORKPLACES.  ALSO CO-DEF:  DARRYN HAMILTON.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamar McNeal in court with attorney Bridget Krause.  Defendant Lamar McNeal in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge ROTHSTEIN, Branch 25.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
